metadata.title: CVE-2017-7519 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In Ceph, a format string flaw was found in the way libradosstriper parsesinput from user. A user could crash an application or service using thelibradosstriper library.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7519` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-common - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-fs-common - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-fuse - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-mds - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-resource-agents - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ceph-test - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libcephfs-java - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libcephfs-jni - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libcephfs1 - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
librados2 - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libradosstriper1 - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
librbd1 - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
librgw2 - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
python-ceph - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
python-cephfs - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
python-rados - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
python-rbd - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
radosgw - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
rbd-fuse - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
rbd-mirror - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
rbd-nbd - 10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.2.10-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
